description.narrative: The Project is expected to reach 77,000 farmers in Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya, safeguarding farmer livelihoods by providing access to markets and access to sustainable farming practices. Volcafe provides technical assistance and training to farmers through its farming as a business program, which aims to help farmers improve their coffee quality, farm productivity and yields, and train farmers on sustainable production, good agronomy, and making the best use of land. In addition, the program also helps them manage risks and exchange information with each other.

The proposed investment is an up to US$30 million in the form of funded participation (IFC Participation) in an up to US$80 million uncommitted secured trade facility (the Facility) arranged by Rand Merchant Bank (RMB or the Bank) for Volcafe Ltd. (Volcafe or the Company) and its East African subsidiaries: namely, Kyagalanyi Coffee Limited (KCL) in Uganda, Taylor Winch Tanzania Limited (TWT) in Tanzania, and Taylor Winch Coffee Limited (TWK) in Kenya (the Project).
